title: Using MAMASANTE to Reconstruct Transmission Patterns: A Vignette
text: MAMASANTE tool designed integrate Dust, Odin, MCState frameworks fitting semi-stochastic mechanistic disease transmission model continuously collected prevalence data using particle Markov chain Monte Carlo (pMCMC). package specifically fits semi-stochastic version ‘malariasimulation’ model monthly malaria prevalence among pregnant women first antenatal care (ANC1) visit. vignette walks simple example outlines various configurable options settings. deterministic version ‘malariasimulation’, seasonal variation malaria transmission intensity governed Fourier series, coefficients pre-estimated historical rainfall data. method provides reasonable seasonal profiles fitting cross-sectional data collected multi-year intervals (data Demographic Health Surveys Malaria Indicator Surveys), lacks flexibility required fitting models monthly prevalence data collected ANC1. enhance flexibility, replaced deterministic seasonal mechanism stochastic process. Specifically, mosquito emergence rates now vary according random-walk process, monthly change mosquito emergence rate modelled : Emergence rate change = δ∼N(0,σ). , σ volatility constant, β, mosquito emergence rate, constrained upper limit βmax maintain realism. pMCMC filters likely emergence rate trajectories comparing observed prevalence model’s estimated prevalence based trajectories. output posterior distribution plausible model trajectories. Since relationship mosquito emergence rates infection prevalence encoded within mechanistic model, MAMASANTE allows us infer trends key indicators like entomological inoculation rate (EIR) clinical incidence, otherwise challenging measure directly.

title: Using MAMASANTE to Reconstruct Transmission Patterns: A Vignette
text: core, approach leverages established relationships temporal infection prevalence dynamics, transmission, clinical burden, defined malariasimulation model. Consequently, can validate inferential framework generating simulated datasets model verifying MAMASANTE correctly recaptures underlying seasonal dynamics. vignette, use simulation based rainfall patterns Tanga, Tanzania, rainfall follows characteristic bimodal pattern. includes: short rainy season (March–May) longer rainy season (November–January) extended dry season (June–October) Bimodal rainfall patterns, Tanga, often present challenging inferential problem many algorithms attempting estimate seasonality. However, applying MAMASANTE, aim recapture complex dynamics without supplying model prior information simulation parameters. resulting relationship malaria prevalence, clinical incidence, EIR Tanga, Tanzania illustrated :

title: Using MAMASANTE to Reconstruct Transmission Patterns: A Vignette
text: Data fitting data frame least three columns: month: Month (formatted ‘yearmon’, provided package ‘zoo’) tested:number individuals tested positive: tested, number positive test results example “tanga_data_slim” samples correct format generated sampling binomially infection prevalence simulation presented .

title: Using MAMASANTE to Reconstruct Transmission Patterns: A Vignette
text: run_pmcmc function central tool fit model observed data. formats provided data set, sets required functions parameters, finally runs pMCMC. Broadly, flow actions follows: Process provided data set, specifically formatting necessary time variables. Format declare parameters. include constant known parameter values needed malariasimulation well pMCMC parameters fit. Set particle filter pMCMC settings. Run pMCMC. Format output.
code: result <- mamasante::run_pmcmc(data_raw=tanga_data_slim,                        n_particles=100,                        target_prev = 0.4,                        n_steps = 10) #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/mamasante/extdata//admin_units_seasonal.rds #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/mamasante/extdata//pgsgmg_corr_sample.rds #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/mamasante/extdata//all_corr_sample.RDS #> ── R CMD INSTALL ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> * installing *source* package ‘odin.model.stripped.seasonal9f89af4b’ ... #> ** using staged installation #> ** libs #> using C compiler: ‘gcc (Ubuntu 13.3.0-6ubuntu2~24.04) 13.3.0’ #> gcc -I"/opt/R/4.4.2/lib/R/include" -DNDEBUG   -I/usr/local/include    -fpic  -g -O2  -UNDEBUG -Wall -pedantic -g -O0 -fdiagnostics-color=always -c odin.c -o odin.o #> odin.c: In function ‘odin_model_stripped_seasonal_initial_conditions’: #> odin.c:2286:10: warning: unused variable ‘t’ [-Wunused-variable] #>  2286 |   double t = scalar_real(t_ptr, "t"); #>       |          ^ #> gcc -I"/opt/R/4.4.2/lib/R/include" -DNDEBUG   -I/usr/local/include    -fpic  -g -O2  -UNDEBUG -Wall -pedantic -g -O0 -fdiagnostics-color=always -c registration.c -o registration.o #> gcc -shared -L/opt/R/4.4.2/lib/R/lib -L/usr/local/lib -o odin.model.stripped.seasonal9f89af4b.so odin.o registration.o -L/opt/R/4.4.2/lib/R/lib -lR #> installing to /tmp/Rtmp1ymgZG/devtools_install_227f715e6489/00LOCK-file227f2e7469aa/00new/odin.model.stripped.seasonal9f89af4b/libs #> ** checking absolute paths in shared objects and dynamic libraries #> * DONE (odin.model.stripped.seasonal9f89af4b) #> Unused equation: mu0 #>  mu0 <- user() # baseline mosquito death rate # (line 323) #> Optimizing initial EIR based on target prevalence. #> Initial EIR set to 29.3. #> Running chain 1 / 1 #> Finished 10 steps in 49 secs #> Time difference of 53.70398 secs

title: Model Parameter List Creation — model_param_list_create
Model Parameter List Creation — model_param_list_create
text: eta Death rate expoential population distribtuion, .e. 1/Mean Population Age. Default = 0.0001305 rho Age-dependent biting parameter. Default = 0.85 a0 Age-dependent biting parameter. Default = 2920 sigma2 Variance log heterogeneity biting rates. Default = 1.67 max_age Maximum age days. Default = 100*365 rA Rate leaving asymptomatic infection. Default = 0.00512821 rT Rate leaving treatment. Default = 0.2 rD Rate leaving clinical disease. Default = 0.2 rU Rate recovering subpatent infection. Default = 0.00906627 rP Rate leaving prophylaxis. Default = 0.06666667 dE Latent period human infection. Default = 12 delayGam Lag parasites infectious gametocytes. Default = 12.5 cD Untreated disease contribution infectiousness. Default = 0.0676909 cT Treated disease contribution infectiousness. Default =   0.322 * cD cU Subpatent disease contribution infectiousness. Default = 0.006203 gamma1 Parameter infectiousness state . Default = 1.82425 d1 Minimum probability due maximum immunity. Default = 0.160527 Inverse decay rate. Default = 3650 ID0 Scale parameter. Default = 1.577533 kD Shape parameter. Default = 0.476614 uD Duration immunity boosted. Default = 9.44512 aD Scale parameter relating age immunity. Default = 8001.99 fD0 Time-scale immunity changes age. Default = 0.007055 gammaD Shape parameter relating age immunity. Default = 4.8183 alphaA PCR detection probability parameters state . Default = 0.757 alphaU PCR detection probability parameters state U. Default = 0.186 b0 Maximum probability due immunity. Default = 0.590076 b1 Maximum relative reduction due immunity. Default = 0.5 dB Inverse decay rate. Default = 3650 IB0 Scale parameter. Default = 43.8787 kB Shape parameter. Default = 2.15506 uB Duration immunity boosted. Default = 7.19919 phi0 Maximum probability due immunity. Default = 0.791666 phi1 Maximum relative reduction due immunity. Default = 0.000737 dCA Inverse decay rate. Default = 10950 IC0 Scale parameter. Default = 18.02366 kC Shape parameter. Default = 2.36949 uCA Duration immunity boosted. Default = 6.06349 PM New-born immunity relative mother’s. Default = 0.774368 dCM Inverse decay rate maternal immunity. Default = 67.6952 delayMos Extrinsic incubation period. Default = 10 tau1 Duration host seeking, assumed constant species. Default = 0.69 tau2 Duration mosquito resting feed. Default = 2.31 mu0 Daily mortality adult mosquitos. Default = 0.132 Q0 Anthrophagy probability. Default = 0.92 chi Endophily probability. Default = 0.86 bites_Bed Percentage bites indoors bed. Default = 0.89 bites_Indoors Percentage bites indoors . Default = 0.97 muEL Per capita daily mortality rate early stage larvae (low density). Default = 0.0338 muLL Per capita daily mortality rate late stage larvae (low density). Default = 0.0348 muPL Per capita daily mortality rate pupae. Default = 0.249 dEL Development time early stage larvae. Default = 6.64 dLL Development time late stage larvae. Default = 3.72 dPL Development time pupae. Default = 0.643 gammaL Relative effect density dependence late instars relative early instars. Default = 13.25 km Seasonal carrying capacity. Default = 11 cm Seasonal birth rate. Default = 0.05 betaL Number eggs laid per day per mosquito. Default = 21.2 num_int Number intervention parameters.  Default = 4 itn_cov proportion people use ITN. Default = 0 irs_cov proportion people living houses sprayed. Default = 0 DY Duration year (days). Default = 365 country Country seasonality profile admin_unit Admin seasonality profile comparison Comparison group used calculate likelihood avg_prev Average prevalence first year data collection ... parameters needed non-standard model. share name defined parameters model_param_list_create stop. can either write extra parameters like individually, e.g. model_param_list_create(extra1 = 1, extra2 = 2) parameteres appear appended returned list, can pass explicitly ellipsis argument list created , e.g. model_param_list_create(...=list(extra1 = 1, extra2 = 2))

title: Run a pMCMC — run_pmcmc
text: function sets runs particle MCMC uses Dust, Odin MCState

title: Run a pMCMC — run_pmcmc
code: run_pmcmc(   data_raw = NULL,   data_raw_pg = NULL,   data_raw_mg = NULL,   init_EIR = 10,   target_prev = NULL,   target_prev_group = "u5",   n_particles = 200,   proposal_matrix = matrix(1),   max_param = 125,   prop_treated = 0.4,   n_steps = 500,   n_threads = 4,   n_chains = 1,   n_workers = 1,   state_check = 0,   country = NULL,   admin_unit = NULL,   seasonality_on = TRUE,   seasonality_check = FALSE,   check_flexibility = FALSE,   seed = 1L,   start_pf_time = 30 * 12,   particle_tune = FALSE,   comparison = "u5",   initial = "informed" )

title: Run a pMCMC — run_pmcmc
text: data_raw Time series data fit model data_raw_pg Time series primigravidae ANC data fit model data_raw_mg Time series multigravidae ANC data fit model init_EIR single value dataframe two columns (time EIR) specify historical malaria transmission levels data collection began. target_prev Return initial EIR value (equilibrium solution), given target prevalence 5yos target_prev_group Age group used target prevalence n_particles Number particles used pMCMC (default = 200) proposal_matrix Proposal matrix MCMC parameters max_param Ceiling proposed stochastic parameter (either EIR betaa) values (default = 1000) prop_treated Proportion clinical cases receive effective treatment (default = 40%) n_steps Number MCMC steps single chain (default = 500) n_threads Number processing threads (default = 4) n_chains Number chains (default = 1) n_workers Number workers (default = 4) state_check state_check = TRUE, returns expected deriv values equal 0 sets stochastic model EIR constant init_EIR state_check = TRUE seasonality_on = 1, deterministic seasonal model still run, theta2 forced 1, forcing constant seasonality profile state_check = FALSE, values printed country Name country (needed using seasonality model) admin_unit Name administrative unit (needed using seasonality model) seasonality_on Toggle seasonality model run observed time period (default = 1) seasonality_check Toggle saving values seasonality equilibrium (default = 1) check_flexibility Toggle saving values flexibility period seed Allows user specify seed (default = 1L) start_pf_time Number days first observation particle filter start (default = 30) particle_tune Logical determine tuning number particles performed. comparison comparison function used. Either 'u5' equates observed prevalence prevalence 5 years old model 'pgmg' calculates prevalence primigravid multigravid pregnant women comparison observed ANC data. c('u5','pg','sg','mg','pgmg','pgsg','ancall') initial initial equilibrium state informed user ('user-informed') observed data ('fitted')?

title: Test the particle filter — test_pf

title: Test the particle filter — test_pf
text: data_raw Time series data fit model data_raw_pg Time series primigravidae ANC data fit model data_raw_mg Time series multigravidae ANC data fit model n_particles Number particles used pMCMC (default = 200) proposal_matrix Proposal matrix MCMC parameters max_param Ceiling proposed stochastic parameter (either EIR betaa) values (default = 1000) max_steps Maximum steps particle filter (default = 1e7) atol atol particle filter (default = 1e-3) rtol rtol particle filter (default = 1e-6) n_steps Number MCMC steps single chain (default = 500) n_threads Number processing threads (default = 4) lag_rates Number delay compartments (default = 10) state_check Run equilibrium checks, state_check = 1, returns expected deriv values equal 0 sets stochastic model EIR constant init_EIR state_check = 1 seasonality_on = 1, deterministic seasonal model still run, theta2 forced 1, forcing constant seasonality profile state_check = 0, values printed country Name country (needed using seasonality model) admin_unit Name administrative unit (needed using seasonality model) preyears Length time years deterministic seasonal model run Jan 1 year observations began (default = 2) seasonality_on Toggle seasonality model run observed time period (default = 1) seasonality_check Toggle saving values seasonality equilibrium (default = 1) seed Allows user specify seed (default = 1L) start_pf_time Number days first observation particle filter start (default = 30) stoch_param parameter test comparison comparison function used. Either 'u5' equates observed prevalence prevalence 5 years old model 'pgmg' calculates prevalence primigravid multigravid pregnant women comparison observed ANC data. c('u5','pg','sg','mg','pgmg','pgsg','ancall')
